title: stylo2gg
text: stylo2gg package designed work data recorded stylo package. following code shows stylo work, measuring word frequencies among eighty-five Federalist Papers, originally published pseudonymously 1788. called , stylo package limits words common least 75% texts (using culling... argumements), saves data object called federalist_mfw, plots texts based word usage principal components analysis: visualization places part frequencies 120 frequent words—chosen among words appearing least three-fourths papers chart shows texts whose authorship question, shown red Xs, frequency distributions similar James Madison, shown green crosses. default, stylo2gg() function uses data visualization settings federalist_mfw: Using selected ggplot2 defaults shapes colors, visualization created stylo2gg nevertheless shows patterns style, presenting figure drawn principal components. , disputed papers marked purple diamonds, seem closest style parts known Madison, marked blue Xs. settings explained different vignette.
code: library(stylo)  federalist_mfw <-    stylo(gui = FALSE,         corpus.dir = system.file("extdata/federalist", package = "stylo2gg"),         analysis.type = "PCR",         pca.visual.flavour = "symbols",         analyzed.features = "w",         ngram.size = 1,         display.on.screen = TRUE,         sampling = "no.sampling",         culling.max = 75,         culling.min = 75,         mfw.min = 900,         mfw.max = 900) library(stylo2gg) federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg()

title: stylo2gg
text: addition two-dimensional relationships principal components, stylo can also show dendrogram cluster analysis, showing texts’ relationships based distance . Dendrogram hierarchical clusters, prepared stylo. federalist_mfw2 object can piped stylo2gg(): principal components analysis, stylo2gg() function defaults recreate chart made stylo(). Alternatively, using unnumbered federalist_mfw object earlier create similar cluster analysis using option viz="CA": Function arguments simplify exploration without necessitating additional calls stylo(). Additional settings explained different vignette.
code: federalist_mfw2 <-    stylo(gui = FALSE,       corpus.dir = system.file("extdata/federalist", package = "stylo2gg"),       custom.graph.title = "Federalist Papers",       analysis.type = "CA",       analyzed.features = "w",       ngram.size = 1,       display.on.screen = TRUE,       sampling = "no.sampling",       culling.max = 75,       culling.min = 75,       mfw.min = 900,       mfw.max = 900) federalist_mfw2 |>    stylo2gg() federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(viz="CA",            shapes = FALSE)
